long: Meaning: to "effect thoroughly"; specifically, to "glean" (also figuratively); by implication (in a bad sense) to "overdo", i.e. "maltreat", "be saucy to", "pain", "impose" (also literal).  Usage: abuse, affect, Ã— child, defile, do, glean, mock, practise, thoroughly, work (wonderfully).  Source: a primitive root;
